entry.summary: Police want Meta, Facebook's parent company, to recover and turn in potentially deleted Facebook messages related to a Eugene shooting that sent one man to the hospital back in June.

entry.title: MUSSELS, RAZOR CLAMS HAVE CLOSED ON SOUTH COAST
entry.summary: July 31, 2024 10:30 a.m. Mussel and razor clam harvesting has closed from the California border to Cape Blanco. An announcement from the Oregon Department of Agriculture and Oregon Department of Fish and Wildfire said mussels are closed for high levels of paralytic shellfish poison while razors are closed for high levels of domoic acid....

entry.title: DUNEFEST UNDERWAY IN WINCHESTER BAY
entry.summary: July 31, 2024 10:00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: This year’s DuneFest event is underway in Winchester Bay. It takes place at the Oregon Dunes Recreational Area. Organizers expect to see nearly 10,000 people over the course of the event. Activities include drag strip racing, pit bike racing, freestyle show, wheelie competition, kids racing, tire...

entry.title: ROSEBURG WOMAN JAILED FOR REPORTED MENACING INCIDENT
entry.summary: July 31, 2024 9:40 a.m. A Roseburg woman was jailed for a reported menacing incident on Tuesday. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said the 48-year-old had been staying with family members and may not have been taking her mental health medications. Tuesday, she reportedly seemed agitated and paranoid. She had been told not to...

entry.title: DEPUTIES JAIL TRANSIENTS IN STOLEN VEHICLE CASE
entry.summary: July 31, 2024 9:20 a.m. Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office jailed a pair of transients in a stolen vehicle case on Tuesday night. A DCSO report said at 7:10 p.m. a deputy located a minivan near the intersection of Brockway Road and Lookingglass Road in Winston and knew it to be stolen. A...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 7.31.24
entry.summary: Snowden Intern for The News Review this summer, Mariah Johnston talks about her work in Douglas County this summer.

entry.title: I Draw Slow brings banjos and cellos to the half shell
entry.summary: Tunes echoed as the eyes of those who were seated on the grass of Stewart Park were glued to watching this week's Music on the Half Shell's performers, I Draw Slow.

entry.title: Lost Bucket Fire contained, most fires remain under suppression efforts
entry.summary: As of Tuesday afternoon, the 33-acre Lost Bucket Fire was declared 100% contained by fire managers. The Lost Bucket Fire is one of seven fires in the Homestead Complex located near Glide.

entry.title: Burdic honored with fallen officer memorial sign on Interstate 5
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — A memorial sign was installed Monday along Interstate 5 in Myrtle Creek thanks to the advocacy of Erlah Burdic and the help of State Rep. Christine Goodwin.

entry.title: Blood drive to help local hospitals
entry.summary: A blood drive will be held from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Aug. 8 in the parking lot of Selectemps, at 3019 NW Sterwart Parkway in Roseburg.

entry.title: Grieving the death of a pet
entry.summary: One of the most painful experiences in life is the death of a loved one — a parent, spouse, sibling or child. What is often under-appreciated is the pain that can come with the death of a loved pet.

entry.title: THRIVE UMPQUA LOVE YOUR NEIGHBORHOOD: DOWNTOWN CLEANUP WEDNESDAY

Necessary supplies like garbage bags, gloves, and pickers will be provided. Free pizza and...

entry.title: 36 ACTIVE LARGE FIRES, OVER 1.2 MILLION ACRES HAVE BURNED IN OREGON
entry.summary: July 31, 2024 4:00 a.m. There are currently 36 active large fires in Oregon. An update from the Oregon Department of Forestry said approximately 9,971 personnel are assigned to the fires, not including many of the local and agency government employees, landowners, forestland operators and community members. entry.title: GOVERNOR KOTEK ORDERS FLAGS LOWERED- JAMES BAILEY MAXWELL
entry.summary: July 31, 2024 3:40 a.m. Governor Tina Kotek has ordered flags at Oregon public institutions to be flown at half-staff through sunset on Thursday in memorial of James Bailey Maxwell. entry.title: FALLEN OFFICER MEMORIAL HIGHWAY SIGN DEDICATED MONDAY

entry.title: La campaña de Harris responde a las acusaciones de Trump en materia de inmigración
entry.summary: (CNN) -- Este martes, la campaña de Harris mostró un primer vistazo sobre cómo planea contrarrestar los ataques del expresidente Donald Trump, quien presenta falsamente a la vicepresidenta Kamala Harris como el “zar fronterizo” de la administración.
